content: quote: Originally posted by ssg91B: I'm confused. Check out Austyn's unit affiliations. I think Austyn is a military supporter that may not be aware of the fact that we prefer our members affiliations to be one of experience in that unit and not just an admiration for said unit. Some here really frown on such practices but rarely ever explain to the offender why we even would be offended. I noticed that he had some MDC friends and decided that this may just be the case. I doubt any of the members here understood completely all of the mysteries of those in the military when at that age. "Don't pick up the package it may be a booby trap". we all learn that basic alert early on on our military careers but we rarely use that same caution when dealing with someone who might be just a little misunderstood. I asked Austyn to stick around and tell us about himself for the simple reason I wanted to lead up to the question of his affiliations and how he experienced those affiliations. Learn to evaluate the situation without becoming negative to someone who might just admire you for all the right reasons and then alienate them from your sphere of influence. When you alienate a person, it makes it much easier for the opposition to use them for their benefit. What I am saying for you guys to think about nurturing that desire in the unknown person/newbie to become one of "the few the proud", or just looking for the adventure of the life of a sailor or soldier. Take it easy on the NEWB! Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

title: Hey

content: I’ve not made up my mind about this young man. His units could be part of his family, friends or is just curious about the Military community. He came in to say “Hey”…no problem. Welcome, please enjoy the form boards, read the TOS, respect other posters or and their opinions, comments and service. When this young man came in and said “Hey” he kinda opened up his friends profile also. There have been 7 MOH winners since Oct 3 1993, and his friend is not one of them. “http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Medal_of_Honor_recipients” Kids will be kids…but kids grow up. There have been more fake MOH winners than true Hero’s that have paid the ultimate sacrifice to save his buddies…. “http://www.dba-oracle.com/t_fake_military_heroes_medals_uniforms.htm” Under the Stolen Valor Act it is now a Federal Offense, punishable by up to $5,000 fine and six months in jail (double that if the offense involves valor awards or the Purple Heart), to claim VERBALLY or in WRITING, to have received any military award you did not. This means among other things that: • If you put in your website, on your resume, or even just verbally claim that you received ANY medal or medals you did not--even something as basic as a campaign ribbon, you have violated Federal law. • If you claim, verbally or in writing, to be a former Ranger, Seal, Delta, USAF Pararescueman, Special Forces, etc. (elite units identified by special BADGES), you have violated Federal Law. (Since Jump Wings are a military badge, claiming jump status would also be a violation. • If you are in a chat room (remember, logs are easy to obtain) or even at your local watering hole, and try to impress a member of the opposite sex with false tales of heroism, elite unit status, or medals, you are committing a Federal offense. Break glass…in case of Emergency! Or, just wait till I get to the bottom of the bottle!
reply: I’ve not made up my mind about this young man. His units could be part of his family, friends or is just curious about the Military community. He came in to say “Hey”…no problem. There have been more fake MOH winners than true Hero’s that have paid the ultimate sacrifice to save his buddies…. “http://www.dba-oracle.com/t_fake_military_heroes_medals_uniforms.htm” Under the Stolen Valor Act it is now a Federal Offense, punishable by up to $5,000 fine and six months in jail (double that if the offense involves valor awards or the Purple Heart), to claim VERBALLY or in WRITING, to have received any military award you did not. This means among other things that: • If you put in your website, on your resume, or even just verbally claim that you received ANY medal or medals you did not--even something as basic as a campaign ribbon, you have violated Federal law. • If you claim, verbally or in writing, to be a former Ranger, Seal, Delta, USAF Pararescueman, Special Forces, etc. (elite units identified by special BADGES), you have violated Federal Law. (Since Jump Wings are a military badge, claiming jump status would also be a violation. • If you are in a chat room (remember, logs are easy to obtain) or even at your local watering hole, and try to impress a member of the opposite sex with false tales of heroism, elite unit status, or medals, you are committing a Federal offense. Break glass…in case of Emergency! Or, just wait till I get to the bottom of the bottle!

Is he a kid just messing around? Then you find out info on the dad and you hunt there and get more info. You all are like a machine. I have to tell you, you make me more alert and thought provoking on issues that I am faced with. I really like your style guys. It is something else to watch the way you go about collecting your info and putting all the peices in to place. At the end of your hunt, I always know you will have the answers and we will be better protected if need be or even make a new friend if so lucky. Thanks for letting me be the fly on the wall so I can watch and learn.
title: Hey
